intro: Cyrtandra × lalaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. Its leaves are usually opposite and lance-shaped, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and unique floral features, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
